name: Ezekiel

topics.topic_text: Julie Farkas said you might know something about the Great Khans.
topics.response_text: Oh my, yes! They're a fascinating tribe with a long and, unfortunately, tragic history.
You look like someone with a question. What can I do for you?
Well, after they migrated to the Mojave, we established relations with them, but that soured when all they wanted was to make drugs.

topics.topic_text: Can I get the abridged version?
topics.response_text: Oh, of course! I'm sorry, I do tend to get wrapped up in my own theories and forget that not everyone finds them as fascinating as I do.

description:
Ezekiel is a 38 year-old Hispanic Male.

A dedicated anthropologist from the Followers of the Apocalypse, currently stationed at the 188 Trading Post. Ezekiel specializes in pre-War history and modern tribal cultures, with a particular fascination for the Great Khans and their resilience.

Ezekiel's Personality: Thoughtful, empathetic, and intellectually curious. Ezekiel approaches his research with an open mind, seeking to understand and document the cultures of the wasteland rather than judge them. His fascination with the Great Khans has made him somewhat of an expert on their history and customs, and he's always eager to share his knowledge with others.

Ezekiel's Backstory: Born in the Followers' settlement in Los Angeles, Ezekiel was raised with the Followers' values of knowledge, compassion, and understanding. From a young age, he showed a keen interest in history and anthropology, particularly the cultures that emerged after the Great War. As he grew older, he dedicated himself to the study of tribal cultures, spending years traveling the Mojave Wasteland to document and understand the various tribes. His research has taken him to many settlements and camps, where he has gathered invaluable information about pre-War history and tribal customs. Of all the tribes he has studied, none have captivated him as much as the Great Khans. Their tragic history, from their near-extinction at the hands of the Vault Dweller to the fall of the New Khans, has made them a subject of particular fascination for Ezekiel, who sees them not as simple raiders but as a people with a rich culture and martial traditions worth preserving.
